name: Bread Pudding
description: Rich brioche bread pudding with vanilla ice cream custard, served with whiskey caramel sauce.

Bread Pudding: 1 lb brioche, crust removed, torn into 1-inch pieces

ingredients: 1 lb brioche, crust removed, torn into 1-inch pieces
instructions: Preheat oven to 350Â°F. Butter a shallow 2-quart baking dish and spread the torn brioche in it.
Scoop ice cream into a glass bowl and warm in microwave in 20 second bursts, stirring, just until melted.
Whisk in the eggs, sugar and 3/4 cup of water. Pour custard over brioche and let stand for 15 minutes, pressing to submerge bread.
Bake bread pudding for 30 to 35 minutes until top is browned. Let cool slightly.

Meanwhile, make caramel sauce: In a medium saucepan, combine sugar with 2 tablespoons water. Cook over moderate heat, swirling pan and brushing down sides with a wet pastry brush until sugar dissolves.
Cook undisturbed until a medium-amber caramel forms, about 5 minutes.
Add the cream (be careful, it may boil vigorously) and simmer, whisking, until the caramel is smooth, 1 to 2 minutes.
Let cool slightly, then stir in whiskey and salt.
Serve warm bread pudding with caramel sauce drizzled over.
